availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William F. Moore (Louisa, Lawrence County merchant)

body.p: Louisa, Kentucky, merchant. Virginia native. Married to Margaret O’Brien Moore. Father of Hannah P. Moore and Frederick Moore. Merchant in Louisa in 1860. Partner in trade with N. D. Redhead. Sutler of the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry.

ab.bibl: Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994038, Lawrence County Marriages, p. 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 187. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 2. Find A Grave, “William Francis Moore (1827-1898),” Memorial #45452316, http://findagrave.com/memorial/45452316 (accessed February 16, 2018). KYR-0001-004-1318.
